{"id": "record_0", "structured_data": {"slide_number": 1, "title": NaN, "content": "['Situation Overview']", "tables": "[]", "images": 0}, "text_representation": "Slide 1:
Situation Overview

Slide 2:
Situation Overview
Recent Earnings Print
Investor Reaction
Q3 ’23: Margin compression due to costs associated with persistent high inventory
Poor operations in macro backdrop
Poor earnings and business quality concerns caused investor sell-off
FY ’23: Weak FY24 earnings guidance due to macro, inventory & distribution expenses
Q4 ’24: Lower sales guidance from weak consumer demand and margin reduction
Down 300 BPs in gross margin
Projected FY loss 400 BPs EBITDA
Revision of 6-7% decline in sales
Structurally lower profitable retailer
Inventory mishap hurts LT brand image
Management ordered inventory too early
High levels = High costs

Slide 3:
Situation Overview
Inventory situation is transitory and will subdue in the near-term
Macro environment and consumer demand will eventually normalize
ATZ historical success is not fad-driven with several brand execution factors
Do we believe current issues are short-term?
Sell-side’s short term view creates an attractive investment opportunity
Time Arbitrage Opportunity
Sell Side View
Conviction in LT Business Quality?
Variant View
Institutional investors sell off stock due to depressed short term outlook
+
We have conviction that long term business fundamentals will be strong
=
Opportunity created through our time horizon
IAG’s investment philosophy is to buy high quality companies that are trading at attractive, low prices
Margins will fail to recover from inventory de-stocking and warehouse costs
ATZ will face difficulty recovering sales with macro affecting consumer demand
Fear of a ‘fad’ business that over-earned and will gradually lose wallet share

Slide 4:
Thesis 1
Clear Path to Sales Target

Slide 5:
Thesis 1: Clear Path to Sales Target
Incremental revenues through expansion in U.S. whitespace

Slide 6:
Thesis 1: Clear Path to Sales Target
eCommerce Is Underdeveloped
Low hanging fruit with eCommerce
Catalysts for eCommerce Growth
CEO Jennifer Wong
New CEO Jennifer Wong pushing eCommerce and LT 45% revenue mix
Already built eCommerce 2.0 platform
Store expansion 
Opening first store in city drives Google Searches up by 2-3 times
80% uplift online sales after 1 store in city is built
“I don't even think he has a laptop still. He’s brick and mortar”“
“She's the fast mover” “The opposite of Brian”
Industry Avg

Slide 7:
Thesis 1: Clear Path to Sales Target
Putting it all together

Slide 8:

CEO Jennifer Wong
